nuggets.text: You can download and use AI-generated media, and media generated for your projects remains accessible even after cancelling your subscription.
AI-generated videos can be monetised depending on the platform and specific content; users should check platform monetisation policies.
AI-generated videos can be used for commercial purposes as customers see fit (subject to platform policies).
All music offered on invideo AI is royalty-free production music sourced from YouTube and Storyblocks.
Invideo AI offers millions of royalty-free media assets from libraries like Storyblocks, Shutterstock, and iStock.
The "Copyrights" collection contains 5 articles including media sourcing, monetisation, monetising with watermarks, and YouTube claim dispute topics.
You can upload and share videos created using invideo AI even if they have watermarks, and there will be no problem monetizing them on social media platforms.
Videos created in your account are not visible to others by default.
Shared videos can be set to private, unlisted, or public.
By default, shared videos are set to public; you can change the default for all videos via "Default export visibility" in settings.
Private visibility allows only you or workspace members to preview a shared video.
Unlisted visibility allows only logged-in InVideo AI users to preview a shared video.
Public visibility allows anyone with the shared link to preview a shared video.
Credits are valid for one year from the date they are added to your account.
After you enter a prompt and click "generate a video," the UI shows the number of credits that will be deducted before creation.
Clicking the dropdown and choosing "Learn more" shows a detailed breakdown and model description for the selected option.
On v4 with the PRO model, generative video costs 20 credits per minute (e.g., 30 seconds = 10 credits; 3 minutes 30 seconds = 70 credits).
On v4 with the ULTRA model, generative video costs 40 credits per minute (e.g., 30 seconds = 20 credits; 3 minutes 30 seconds = 140 credits).
Creating videos with actors adds 5 credits per video minute (e.g., 2 minutes or less = +10 credits; 5 minutes or less = +25 credits).
For stock/basic media with a human or virtual pro actor on v4, video duration is rounded up to the next whole minute.
nuggets.note: This v4 rounding rule differs from the v3 rounding table in the v3 video minutes article.

nuggets.text: For stock/basic media with a human or virtual pro actor on v4, video duration has a minimum charge of 1 minute.
nuggets.note: This v4 rounding rule differs from the v3 rounding table in the v3 video minutes article.

nuggets.text: On v3, video minutes are used when creating videos using ‘stock’ and ‘generative’ media; a 1-minute video uses 1 video minute and 7 credits if it also uses generative media.
nuggets.note: This v3 statement differs from the credit-changes article describing video minutes being counted only for certain stock-media cases.

nuggets.text: On v3, video minutes are rounded as: 0:01–1:29 => 1 minute; 1:30–2:29 => 2 minutes; 2:30–3:29 => 3 minutes; 3:30–4:29 => 4 minutes; 4:30–5:29 => 5 minutes.
nuggets.note: This v3 rounding table differs from the v4 rule that rounds up to the next whole minute with a minimum of 1 minute.

nuggets.text: Under the newer system, video minutes are counted only when creating videos using stock media with your own avatar or for faceless videos.
nuggets.note: This statement differs from the v3 video-minutes article stating video minutes are used for stock and generative media.

nuggets.text: Under the newer system, credits are used for videos that include generative media (with or without an actor) or for stock media with an actor.
The new system has been in effect for new users since June 13, 2025; for v4 videos the new credit system applies, while v3 usage remains tracked in the older system.
To change a video’s aspect ratio, you enter a command in the Magic Box after clicking "Edit & Download" to exit Theatre mode.
Magic Box commands can set the aspect ratio to landscape or portrait and can use terms like 16:9/9:16 and vertical/horizontal.
In invideo AI, you can adjust media using x and y centre points from Edit > Media > Media properties.
X-Axis moves media side-to-side when the video is 9:16 (vertical), and Y-Axis moves media up/down when the video is 16:9 (wide).
For 16:9 videos, moving media up/down is only possible if there is space around the media to move it.
For website subscriptions, cancellation is initiated from the profile menu by selecting "Subscription" and then clicking "Cancel," followed by confirming "Yes, cancel."
After cancelling an active subscription, the plan remains active until the end of the current period, then the account is downgraded to the free version.
The card is removed automatically from the account once you’re on the free plan.
The "Plan Changes & Cancellations" collection contains 3 articles: downgrade to a lower plan, cancel subscription, and refund policy.
The "Pricing & Plans" collection contains 20 articles, including plan comparisons, free plan usage, cancellations, and credit changes.
The "Troubleshooting" collection contains 1 article: "Optimal settings we recommend for using invideo with the smoothest experience."
The "Others" collection contains 6 articles including preview quality, undo/redo edits, downloading AI-generated media, and model context protocol server.
Generated videos preview in 720p resolution by default.
Preview quality can be changed via the gear icon on the bottom right of the preview by choosing another resolution.
Watermarks are visible on the preview page by default.
nuggets.note: This article distinguishes preview watermarks vs exported output.

nuggets.text: Watermarks are removed when you export the video.
nuggets.note: This article distinguishes preview watermarks vs exported output.

nuggets.text: Projects exported before subscribing to a paid plan will still contain watermarks.
To remove watermarks from a project exported before subscribing, re-export the original project after subscribing and selecting appropriate options.
A video created on a paid plan can be edited and downloaded without a watermark while the plan is active.
After the plan expires and the account moves to the Free plan, edits to the video require a paid plan to download without a watermark.
On the free plan, exported videos have an InVideo watermark.
On the free plan, exported videos have stock media watermarks.
Upgrading to a paid plan can remove watermarks.
Free plan exports include an InVideo logo watermark.
Invideo AI plans include unlimited high-definition (HD) video exports.
Invideo AI plans include access to royalty-free premium media from iStock, Storyblocks and Shutterstock.
Free plan includes 2 video minutes per week.
Free plan includes 1 AI credit per week.
Free plan includes 1 Express avatar.
Free plan includes 4 exports per week.
Weekly quota on the Free plan resets weekly on Monday at 12 a.m. UTC.
Free plan includes 10 GB storage.
Any quota does not roll over into the next billing cycle; if unused, it expires at the end of your billing cycle.
Free plan exports include an InVideo watermark.
You can use invideo AI for free without entering card details.
Free plan includes 10 GB storage.
Free plan includes 1 AI credit.
Free plan includes access to 2.5M+ standard media assets.
Each plan provides a monthly allocation of video minutes, credits and iStock assets, along with storage and cloning capabilities.
The Team plan supports up to 50 seats, with usage scaling based on the number of seats selected.
The Plus, Max and Generative plans can be boosted up to 5x for higher monthly limits.
Plan comparison lists credits quotas as 10, 40, 100, and 1000.
Plan comparison lists video minutes quotas as 50, 200, 200, and 1000.
Plan comparison lists iStock asset quotas as 95, 320, 320, and 3200.
Plan comparison lists Express clones quotas as 2, 5, 8, and 40.
Plan comparison lists storage quotas as 100 GB, 400 GB, 400 GB, and 4 TB.
Monthly quota resets each month.
Additional quota can be shared with team members or used entirely by one user.
The privacy policy describes collection and use of information such as account and usage data for providing and improving the services.
The privacy policy describes sharing information with service providers to operate the services.
Invideo does not guarantee that AI-generated content is unique, original, or non-infringing, and it may not be protectable by intellectual property rights.
You retain ownership of your Customer Content.
You grant InVideo a license to use your Customer Content to provide and improve the services (as described in the terms).
Invideo may delete or remove content at its discretion and is not obligated to store or maintain copies of user content.
Users can access a library of over 7000 customizable marketing video templates.
The platform provides access to over 16 million stock media assets including content from iStock.
Users on the Business plan are limited to 60 HD video exports per month.
The Unlimited plan allows for unlimited HD video exports.
Background removal is limited to 20 images per month on the Business plan.
Users can collaborate with team members on video projects.
The Magic Box feature allows users to edit video clips using simple text commands like delete scenes.
Videos can be automatically translated into over 50 global languages.
The tool supports creating content specifically for YouTube Shorts.
Integrated AI models for video generation include Sora 2 and Google Veo 3.1.
Users can clone their own voice for use in video narration.
The platform includes non-negotiable topic blocks to protect AI actor likenesses.
The recommended video format for Instagram export is MP4.
Supported resolutions include 1080x1080 for feed videos and 1080x1920 for Stories.
The editor provides over 6000 pre-designed templates specifically for Instagram.
Users can add transitions like lens flare and bokeh blur between scenes.
The tool allows creation of diverse content types including video bios and Reels.
Users can keep Instagram feed videos under 60 seconds to ensure optimal performance.
The Plus plan allows for 30 seconds of generative video creation per month.
The Max plan includes 120 seconds of generative video creation per month.
Free users are limited to 2 video minutes and 1 AI credit per week.
Paid plans include unlimited image generations using the Nano Banana Pro model.
Users can define the audience and platform before generating a promo video.
The tool supports over 50 different promo video styles via workflows.
Users can drag and drop their own photos and videos to replace default stock media.
Collage templates are available in aspect ratios of 16:9, 9:16, and 1:1.
Users can trim audio tracks to sync with specific images in the collage.
The tool supports adding loop effects to soundtracks.
Exports on the free plan include a watermark.
Templates are pre-cut to match background music beats.
A recording of at least 30 seconds is required to create a voice clone.
Users must verify permission before cloning another person's voice.
Users can generate voiceovers in over 50 languages including diverse accents.
Voice options include male, female, young, and old vocal types.

The platform provides quick utility tools including Video Trimmer, Video Compressor, and MP4 Compressor.
Users can access specialized tools for Face Swap and Face Swap Video.
The editor includes a Screen Recorder utility for capturing content.
Users can use Magic Box text commands to delete scenes or mute audio.
Qwen Edit tools include Edit Skin, Face Portrait, and Group Photo adjustments.
Users can place products naturally into images with correct lighting and depth using the Add Product tool.
The Multi-Angle tool creates new camera angles while keeping the subject consistent.
Users can remove harsh light spots and unwanted objects using the Remove Light & Elements tool.
The Next Scene tool builds the logical next moment of an image for scene continuity.
The VFX House suite includes specific tools for Relight, Inpaint and Cleanup, and AI Colorist.
Users can use Prop Swap and Key Lab tools for object manipulation.
Advanced VFX capabilities include Virtual Production, 3D Texturizer, and Continuity Engine.
Refraction and Re-frame tools are available for video adjustment.
the platform provides quick utility tools including video trimmer, video compressor, and mp4 compressor
users can access specialized tools for face swap and face swap video
the editor includes a screen recorder utility for capturing content
users can use magic box text commands to delete scenes or mute audio

Users can generate videos from simple text prompts or full scripts.
The platform supports video resolution up to 4K with selected models.
Users can edit videos using text commands in the Magic Box like delete scene or change voiceover.
The tool supports creating content in over 50 languages.
Integrated AI models include Sora 2 and Google Veo 3.1.
Users can access over 16 million licensed stock media clips.
The text-to-speech tool generates human-like voiceovers in male and female voices.
Supported languages for voice generation include over 50 global languages.
Users can export the final output as a video and convert it to MP3 using an internal converter.
Free account users are limited to exporting up to 4 videos per week.
Exports on the free plan include an InVideo watermark.
The tool allows users to choose from diverse accents including young and old voice types.
Users must upload a recording of at least 30 seconds to clone their voice.
The tool creates a digital clone of a voice within seconds.
Users can clone another person's voice only with explicit permission.
Verification processes are in place to prevent unauthorized voice cloning.
Cloned voices can be used to generate voiceovers in multiple languages.
YouTube monetization is allowed for videos using AI-generated voices if guidelines are followed.
Users can paste a blog article URL to generate a video.
The tool automatically adds visuals, background music, and voiceovers to the generated video.
Users can select video length and platform settings before generation.
Content moderation systems use both human and AI review to safeguard users.
Face-matching technology is used to block unauthorized use of likenesses.
Generated videos can include realistic AI voices in over 50 global languages.
Express avatars can be created in under 5 minutes using a webcam recording or YouTube link.
Pro Avatars require recordings of 30 minutes or more to achieve studio quality.
Users must provide a 60-second video of themselves for custom avatar creation.
New footage is required to generate an AI avatar in different physical setups.
The tool supports lip sync video creation using digital avatars.
Users must record consent following on-screen instructions to create an AI twin.
Users can upload JPG, PNG, or WebP images to convert them into video.
The generation process takes approximately 60 seconds.
Video output can be up to 4K quality.
Supported aspect ratios include 16:9, 9:16, and others fitting social platforms.
Users can control motion with text prompts like 'Zoom in slowly' or 'Pan across'.
The maximum video duration for image-to-video generation is 8 seconds.
The tool can automatically generate subtitles in over 50 global languages.
Available subtitle styles include Hormozi, comic, clean, and karaoke word-by-word effects.
Users can change subtitle styles and languages using text commands in the Magic Box.
Supported fonts include Montserrat, Roboto, Arial, and Comic Sans.
Users can position subtitles at the top, center, or bottom, or specify exact percentage positions.
The free version generates videos with subtitles but includes a watermark.
Users can create faceless videos on any topic using a single text prompt.
The tool automatically writes scripts and adds relevant media, voiceovers, and sound effects.
Workflows are available to structure prompts for over 50 video styles.
AI Actors control how their likeness is used with non-negotiable topic blocks.
Users can clone product catalogs into polished ads and demos.
The tool supports creating content without any recording equipment.

The platform supports a wide range of video generation models including Google Veo (3.1/3/2), Sora 2 (Pro), Kling (2.6/Video O1), LTX-2 Pro, Pixverse (5.5/5), Wan (2.6/2.5), and Minimax Hailuo (2.3/02).
Specialized video motion and animation models include Kling 2.6 Motion Control, Wan 2.2 Animate Move, Wan 2.2 Animate Replace, and Seedance (Pro/1.5 Pro).
Video upscaling is provided by Crystal Upscaler, FlashVSR, SeedVR, Bytedance Video Upscaler, Topaz Video Upscaler, Runway Upscaler v1, and Gen-4 Aleph.
Lip sync capabilities are supported by Pixverse Lipsync, Kling Lipsync, Rapid Lipsync, and Pipio Lipsync models.
Image generation models include Midjourney V7, GPT Image 1.5, Seedream (4.5/4), Flux 2 (Pro/Flex/Max), Ideogram v3, and Nano Banana Pro.
The Qwen Edit suite provides specific tools for Skin, Relight, Multiple Angles, Shirt Design, Product Integration, and Scene Extension.
Advanced image editing models include Reve (Remix/Edit), Bria BG Remove, BiRefNet BG Remove, Clarity Upscaler, and Magnific Upscaler (Creative/Precision/Skin).
Audio generation models include ElevenLabs Voice Design, ElevenLabs Text to Speech, Maya 1, VibeVoice 7B, Minimax Speech 2.6, and Sonic 3.
Music generation utilizes ElevenLabs Music V1 (Song/Instrumental), Sonauto V2 (Song/Instrumental), Google Lyria-002, Minimax Music 2.0, and Mureka 7.5.
Additional creative models listed include Grok Imagine (Video/Image), Higgsfield (Dop/Soul), and Kling Effects.

examples.title: Credit table example (PRO model)
examples.scenario: Estimating credits for different video durations on v4 PRO model
examples.snippet: PRO model cost is 20 credits per minute; the table shows 30 seconds = 10 credits, 1 minute = 20 credits, 3 minutes 30 seconds = 70 credits.

examples.title: 3-minute example (v3)
examples.scenario: Estimating remaining video minutes after making a 3-minute video on v3
examples.snippet: Example: creating a 3-minute video reduces a 200 video-minute balance to 197, and a 50 video-minute balance to 47.
